chargeHist.descr: Possess Cocaine with intent to deliver-2nd or subsequent (>15-40g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant KC WHITE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess cocaine w/Intent to deliver (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the sentence presently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with any known drug dealers or users.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
Ann Larson, public defender.
RE:  Possess cocaine with intent to deliver-2nd or subsequent, on 10-30-15.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess cocaine with intent to deliver.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 11-23-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.   Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
